case_vignette: A 33-year-old man presents to the emergency department with joint pain. He states that since yesterday he has had joint pain, and today he noticed a rash. The patient does not have a significant past medical history. The patient smokes cigars, drinks 1 to 4 drinks per day, is sexually active, and uses cocaine occasionally. His temperature is 101°F (38.3°C), blood pressure is 125/65 mmHg, pulse is 80/min, respirations are 14/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. Physical exam reveals pustular skin lesions and an inflamed and painful right knee that is warm to the touch.

Can you tell me if you have noticed any pus or discharge from your knee? And have you experienced any night sweats or weight loss recently? These can be signs of a more serious infection.

Also, have you had any recent exposure to any insect or animal bites in the knee area? This can also be a cause of infection.
There's no discharge from my knee, and I haven't had night sweats or weight loss. Also, I haven't had any insect or animal bites there.

Great, thank you for letting me know. Based on your symptoms and medical history, I would like to recommend that you see a doctor as soon as possible for further evaluation and treatment.

It's possible that you have a bacterial infection in your knee that requires antibiotic treatment. Your doctor can perform a thorough examination and take a sample of your knee fluid to determine the cause of your symptoms and provide the appropriate treatment.

In the meantime, you can apply ice to the affected area to reduce swelling and pain, and avoid any strenuous activities that may exacerbate the condition.

Please seek medical attention as soon as possible to get proper treatment and prevent the infection from spreading or causing any further complications.

He has no significant past medical history, no history of injuries or surgeries, and has not started any new medications or supplements. He does smoke cigars, but has no known allergies or sensitivities to medications or substances. His knee is swollen and red, and he has been running a fever. He denies recent travel and does not know anyone with a similar infection. There is no discharge from the affected knee, and he has not experienced night sweats or weight loss. He also denies any insect or animal bites in the area.
